intro: Liabum cardenasii, commonly known as the Cardenas's liabum, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Central America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and white. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
